metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15664 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Docker through 18.06.1-ce-rc2, the API endpoints behind the 'docker cp' command are vulnerable to a symlink-exchange attack with Directory Traversal, giving attackers arbitrary read-write access to the host filesystem with root privileges, because daemon/archive.go does not do archive operations on a frozen filesystem (or from within a chroot).

notes.Note: mdeslaur> initial commits caused a regression which then got fixed, see upstream bug

criterions.comment: docker.io: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
